title: Adversarial Robustness Certification for Bayesian Neural Networks. (arXiv:2306.13614v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: We study the problem of certifying the robustness of Bayesian neural networks (BNNs) to adversarial input perturbations. Given a compact set of input points $T \subseteq \mathbb{R}^m$ and a set of output points $S \subseteq \mathbb{R}^n$, we define two notions of robustness for BNNs in an adversarial setting: probabilistic robustness and decision robustness. Probabilistic robustness is the probability that for all points in $T$ the output of a BNN sampled from the posterior is in $S$. On the other hand, decision robustness considers the optimal decision of a BNN and checks if for all points in $T$ the optimal decision of the BNN for a given loss function lies within the output set $S$. Although exact computation of these robustness properties is challenging due to the probabilistic and non-convex nature of BNNs, we present a unified computational framework for efficiently and formally bounding them. translated_abstract: 本文研究了证明贝叶斯神经网络对对抗性输入扰动的鲁棒性的问题。我们定义了两种贝叶斯神经网络在对抗性设置下的鲁棒性概念：概率鲁棒性和决策鲁棒性。尽管由于贝叶斯神经网络的概率性和非凸性质，这些鲁棒性属性的精确计算具有挑战性，但我们提出了一个统一的计算框架来有效地和形式化地进行边界计算。我们的方法基于权重区间采样、积分和边界传播。
tldr: 本文研究了证明贝叶斯神经网络对对抗性输入扰动的鲁棒性的问题，并提出了一种统一的计算框架。
en_tdlr: This paper studies the problem of proving the robustness of Bayesian neural networks to adversarial input perturbations and proposes a unified computational framework.
